HPI 8536 McLaren F1 GT-R 1995 24 Hours of Le Mans Winner Y. Dalmas/J. J. Lehto/M. Sekiya (Night Version)

Only Le Mans win for McLaren
4th Le Mans win for Yannick Dalmas
First Le Mans win for J. J. Lehto
Only Le Mans win for Masanori Sekiya

McLaren's win at the 24 Hours of Le Mans in 1995 was an incredible accomplishment considering the F1 GT-R was essentially a road car competing against purpose-built prototype racers. It was also noteworthy as they won on their first attempt. McLaren's site says they are the only manufacturer to win on their first attempt but they seem to be wrong for 2 reasons:

[list]
Only manufacturer? Chenard & Walcker won the first event and therefore were definitely the first manufacturer to win on their first attempt. :lol: The Le Mans History site also lists Ferrari (1949), Dauer (1994), & TWR (1996) as manufacturers that won on their first attempt

First attempt? In 1981 a McLaren M12 GT was entered but did not qualify. I guess technically the McLaren did not compete but it was entered.
[/list]

This is the night version of the car made specially for KIDBOX in Japan. There is an alignment issue with the gray part of the bodywork at the bottom of the car. The 2 parts are not flush where they meet at the bottom point of the door. I've seen this issue in photos of this and other other HPI McLaren models.
